rois.name: bias_readout
rois.description: ROI covering the displayed bias value (V) in Nanonis.

rois.name: scan_status
rois.description: ROI covering scan status. It only tells the current status of scanning: <scanning>, <paused>, and <idle>, if you need to get how long the scanning will take, refer to the scan time countdown ROI. It's an icon made of 2 black bars. If the Icon is in black, then it means the scanning is in progress, return <scanning>. If the icon is in black and has a square gray shadow background, then it means the scanning is on paused, return: <paused>. If the icon is in faded gray color, it means there's no scanning in progress, return <idle>.

rois.name: set_current_readout
rois.description: ROI covering the displayed set current value (A) in Nanonis. It does not always equal to the real current. Since this set current is only used in the constant-current-scanning mode to set the current that STM tries to maintain. But the actual real current depends on the tip's microscopical geometry and the electronic status.

rois.name: scan_time_countdown_readout
rois.description: The scan time count down indicated the time that current scan needs to finish. If you need to decide how long to wait for the scanning, refer to this ROI.

rois.name: real_current_readout
rois.description: ROI covering the displayed real current value (A) in Nanonis.

anchors.name: bias_input
anchors.description: Anchor point of bias input box. Remember the unit "V" embedded in the box is not part of the input value. For example, if you need to input 700mV, return either "0.7" or "700m".

anchors.name: scan_start_from_top_button
anchors.description: Click target on the Start Scan From Top button.

anchors.name: scan_start_from_bottom_button
anchors.description: Click target on the Start Scan From bottom button.

anchors.name: set_current_input
anchors.description: Anchor point of current input box. Remember the unit "A" embedded in the box is not part of the input value. For example, if you need to input 50pA, return either "0.000000000005" or "50p" the cap of this input is 10nA.
